page.syntax: Result as C = ftp_script_run(C title ,C ftp_script [,L background [,N total_bytes ]])

argument.name: Result
argument.description:
The return value is only meaningful if Background is set to .F.
"OK" = All FTP commands were executed.
"Cancel" = User clicked the Cancel button before all FTP commands had executed.
"Error" = An error was encountered).

argument.name: ftp_script
argument.description: A CR-LF delimited list of ftp commands to execute (See ((|#FTP_Command_Syntax|FTP Command Syntax)) below). Character

argument.name: background
argument.description:
Logical, .T. = Tile transfer takes place in the background. The progress dialog box that is displayed is modeless.
.F. - File transfer takes place in the foreground. The progress dialog box that is displayed is modal.

argument.name: total_bytes
argument.description: Numeric. The total number of bytes to be transferred by the FTP operation. If this value is specified, then the progress dialog box will display a progress bar.

page.description: Run an alpha five FTP script...
page.discussion: Alpha Anywhere has a simple "FTP language" that can be used to write scripts that execute various FTP commands such as uploading and downloading files, making folders on the remove FTP target, renaming and deleting files and folders, etc. This function executes a FTP script created by FTP_MakeCommandList().

item.name: connect| Address
item.description: Connects to an FTP site specified by Address

item.name: login| User | Password
item.description: Logs in to an FTP site.

item.name: list| Optional_Mask
item.description: Lists files on a FTP site and places the result in the List_Result variable. The Eval command can use List_Result. To list only files that match a mask, specify the Optional_Mask.

item.name: nlist| Optional_Mask
item.description: Lists files (filenames only, no additional information) on a FTP site and places the result in the List_Result variable. This variable can be used in the Eval command. To list only files that match a mask, specify the Optional_Mask.

item.name: quit
item.description: End the FTP session.

item.name: cd| Path
item.description: Change the working directory on the FTP site.

item.name: binary
item.description: Execute this command before transferring a binary file.

item.name: ascii
item.description: Execute this command before transferring an ASCII file

item.name: pwd
item.description: Returns the name of the current working directory (i.e. folder) on the FTP site and places it in the Result variable which can be used in an expression with the Eval command

item.name: rm| File_Name
item.description: Deletes a file on the FTP site

item.name: mkdir| Folder_Name
item.description: Makes a folder on the FTP site.

item.name: rmdir| Folder_Name
item.description: Deletes a folder on the FTP site.

item.name: rename| Old_File_Name | New_File_Name
item.description: Renames a file on the FTP site.

item.name: get| Remote_File_Name | Local_File_Name
item.description: Transfers a file from the FTP site to the local machine.

item.name: put| Local_File_Name | Remote_File_Name
item.description: Transfers a file from the local machine to the FTP site.

item.name: eval| Expression
item.description: Evaluates Expression and then executes the resulting command. The eval command, in effect, allows you to dynamically generate FTP commands to be executed. The Expression can reference the following special variables: Result = Result of last FTP command (e.g. error code returned, path returned by PWD command, etc.) List_Result = List of files returned by LIST or NLIST command.

item.name: onerror| Command
item.description: If the prior FTP command fails, then the Command specified by onerror is executed.

item.name: log| Text
item.description: Concatenates text to the status text displayed by the progress dialog box.

item.name: error| Text
item.description: Reports an error and quits the session.

item.name: replace| Searchtext | Replacetext
item.description: Modifies the commands that follow in the script. An example of how this might be used is to replace a placeholder in the script with the folder name that is retrieved through the pwd command.
